title: Follow-Up Worksheet #1: Ask the Right Questions
description: For New & Emerging Leaders Who Want to Get Unstuck and Execute with Clarity

sections.title: Quick Check — Are You Stuck Here?

questions.text: Which of these statements apply to you? (Check all that apply)
options: I jumped straight to conclusions without exploring other angles.
I didn't actually ask my team or others how they see this.
I feel certain I know the problem — but results haven't changed.
I've been avoiding tough or uncomfortable questions.

questions.text: What assumption am I making that might be completely wrong?
Who could give me a totally different perspective?
What question am I most afraid to ask — and why?
This week I will ask _____________ before making my next decision.

title: Follow-Up Worksheet #2: Identify the Issues
description: For New & Emerging Leaders Who Want to Get Unstuck and Execute with Clarity

sections.title: Quick Check — Are You Stuck Here?

questions.text: Which of these statements apply to you? (Check all that apply)
options: I keep fixing things but the same problems keep returning.
I focused on what's easiest to see — not what's driving it underneath.
I've avoided asking: is this the symptom or the true source?

questions.text: What evidence actually proves this is the core issue?
Who disagrees with me, and why might they be right?
If I solve this, what else will stay broken?
This week I will dig deeper by _____________.

title: Follow-Up Worksheet #3: Find the Best Solution
description: For New & Emerging Leaders Who Want to Get Unstuck and Execute with Clarity

sections.title: Quick Check — Are You Stuck Here?

questions.text: Which of these statements apply to you? (Check all that apply)
options: I chose a solution because it felt safest or quickest.
I didn't check if it truly solves the root issue.
I skipped evaluating if this fits our current resources or long-term goals.

questions.text: What's the difference between the solution that feels easiest vs. what's most effective?
What might this look like if you had unlimited courage (but the same budget)?
Who on your team could pressure-test this idea?
This week I will validate my solution by _____________.

title: Follow-Up Worksheet #4: Execute and Succeed
description: For New & Emerging Leaders Who Want to Get Unstuck and Execute with Clarity

sections.title: Quick Check — Are You Stuck Here?

questions.text: Which of these statements apply to you? (Check all that apply)
options: I made a plan but never actually scheduled the work.
I didn't share my commitment publicly or set accountability.
I keep breaking the same promise to myself or my team.

questions.text: What small piece could you execute immediately to build momentum?
Who can you ask to hold you accountable this week?
What's your track record on follow-through — and how will you break the old pattern?
This week I will follow through by _____________.
